channel.title: Metasploit on Research Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Metasploit on Research Notes

item.title: Embedding Shellcode Code Caves
item.description: Theory Load malicious bytes into the “code cave” of a portable executable. This doesn’t change the file size, because you will be replacing bytes that already exist with malicious code. Typically, when a PE file executes, it follows the instructions from top to bottom. In contrary, when a trojan executes, it will immediately jump to the section containing the shellcode, execute the it and then return back the top of the file and run the program as usual.
